div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 16:35 pm CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly after 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southeast wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
A 10 percent chance of showers before 7am. Sunny, with a high near 80. South southwest wind 8 to 11 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 56. South wind 6 to 8 mph.

span.span: Dear Parents/Guardians:
Here is an update regarding Southern’s COVID-19 plans:
Breakfast & Lunch Opportunities:
The last day the district will be providing free meals is on Wednesday, May 20, 2020. On Wednesday, May 20, 2020, it will include 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches.
Contingency Plan for the Fall:
The

Commissioner of Education, Matt Blomstedt, recently went on record and advised local district leaders to draw up contingency plans in case the coronavirus crisis lingers on in the fall. It’s hard to say yet what the situation might look like this fall, but possibilities include delaying the start of the school year, separating students into groups and rotating them into school buildings at different times or using partial or complete distance learning. The administration is current working on different

contingency plans for the fall, while being fully aware that parents work fulltime jobs and that preschool/elementary students cannot be left at home alone on different days during a given school week. If a
contingency plan is needed, it will be released to the public in early July.
Continuity of Learning Plan:
The last day that seniors will be participating in the district’s Continuity of Learning Plan is on
May 8, 2020. The last day that preschool through juniors will be participating in the district’s Continuity of Learning Plan is on May 21, 2020.
Extending Reading & Math Blocks (Students Going into 1st-3rd Grade):

Since learning reading and math at the primary grades provide the building blocks for students to be successful in the years ahead, the district is planning on changing all 1st-3rd grade schedules for next year to provide more time for reading and math instruction. We will be using the daily science and social studies block during the first quarter to get students caught up on these foundational skills that they missed out on during the school closure.
Graduation 2020:

Southern has set August 1 at 5:00 p.m. for our graduation ceremony. Our hope is to hold a traditional ceremony, however, at this point, we are planning three options: a traditional ceremony, an alternate ceremony with limited attendance, or a virtual ceremony (Depending on the Directed Health Measure at that time).
Summer School Packets (Students Going into 1st-6th Grade):
We will once again be offering summer school to all students going into 1st-6th grade. Based on the Directed Health Measure,
will be providing optional summer school packets to be completed during the first four weeks in June. The summer school packets can be picked up at the Elementary School from
11:30 a.m. – 12:15 p.m. on one of the following days: May 15, May 18, or May 20.
Students participation in summer school is not required.
If you have any questions, please feel free to contact your building principal.
Sincerely,
Southern Public Schools

a.aria-label: Read more about Update on Southern’s COVID-19 plans:

div.p: Parents...these are challenging times. We are here to help should you need it, but please know additional help is available. Families can call the
Nebraska Family Helpline at 888-866-8660 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
to speak with a trained counselor regarding any assistance you might need.

Students...You know we are here to help should you need us. We want you also to remember the Boys Town National Hotline is available 24/7 to help anyone who may need assistance. Call: 1 800-448-3000. Text: "Voice" to 20121. Chat: yourlifeyourvoice.org

a.aria-label: Read more about Challenging Times---Helpful Phone Calls

h3.a: GOOD NEWS from the University System

div.p: The University system (Lincoln, Omaha, Kearney) just announced due to Covid 19 they will be providing free tuition to any student who has a family income of $60,000 or less. Attached are some links that will be helpful in sharing the news. Questions please contact Dr. Bond.

a.aria-label: Read more about GOOD NEWS from the University System

div.blockquote: With our current issues in dealing with the COVID-19, the NSAA will be coming out with a new mandate regarding Athletic Physicals for the 20-21 Academic School year. All athletes that will be Sophomores, Juniors and Seniors in the 20-21 school year will be able to use their Athletic Physical from the 2019-20 school year. All incoming Freshman will still be required to provide the Physicals no earlier than May 1, 2020. For students entering 7th grade you will are still required to provide the Physicals to enter 7th grade no earlier than May 1, 2020. 8th Grade students will also be able to use their 2019-20 physicals this school year. This is only a one-year exemption for students in all classes.

a.aria-label: Read more about April 2020 Board Minutes

h3.a: Southern Public Schools Continuity of Learning Plan

span.span: Dear Parents/Guardians:
Here is an update regarding Southern’s COVID-19 plans:

b.span: Continuity of Learning Plan (Starting on April 7 & lasting until students report back to school):

span.span: With the extension of the school closure until May 1, Southern Public Schools will be implementing phase two of our Continuity of Learning Plan. The entire document can be found on the district website and on our Facebook page. Southern Public Schools will be implementing a pass/fail grading system for the fourth quarter. Here are some highlights from the Continuity of Learning Plan:

Teachers will be creating paper packets of enrichment activities. Parents are asked to print the packets at home and they will be available on the district website. If you are unable to print the packet at home, please email your classroom teacher and we will provide a printed packet for you to pick up from the office at a designated time.

The class schedule is posted on the Continuity of Learning Plan (Page 8) and students can log on to the designated classes during the assigned times on the schedule. Classroom teachers will be available online during the designated times. Classroom teachers will be available online every Thursday morning to assist students as needed.
2) Dual credit classes may require additional class meeting time. Second-semester grades in dual credit classes will NOT be included on the student high school transcript.
3) Students that do not have Internet access at home must contact Mr. Murphy immediately to discuss alternate learning options.

b.span: Breakfast & Lunch Opportunities (New Federal/District Updates Listed Below):

span.span: Based on new flexibility from the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), parents/guardians can pick up meals for children in their household without the children being present as long as the parents/guardians provides names of the children for whom they are picking up meals for. In addition, no one will need to contact the district from here on out if you plan to show up and get a free meal for children ages 1-18. We were just trying to get an accurate count of meals to prepare so we did not run out.

u.span: Starting on Monday, April 6, we will also be offering free meals at the park in Barneston from 12:00 p.m. – 12:15 p.m. on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays

span.span: . We will still be offering free meals at both the Elementary School building and the Jr./Sr. High School building from 11:30 a.m. – 12:15 p.m. on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Please Note: On Mondays and Wednesdays, it will include 2 breakfasts and 2 lunches, and on Fridays, it will include 1 breakfast and 1 lunch.

u.span: On Wednesday, April 8, we will be offering 3 breakfasts and 3 lunches and we will not be serving any meals on Friday, April 10. We will resume our normal meal schedule starting on Monday, April 13.

span.span: If you have any questions, please feel free to contact your building principal.
Sincerely,
Southern Public Schools

h3.a: COVID-19 Pandemic update for Southern Public Schools March 23, 2020

blockquote.p: After consultation with our Health Department and other State and Local officials, it has been determined that all schools in the ESU 5 Region will be closed through Friday, May 1st, with the possibility of schools being closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This decision will be re-evaluated as circumstances change, and another announcement will be made on April 22nd concerning the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. This is a precautionary public health measure; local health and school officials are monitoring the COVID-19 situation in Southeast Nebraska closely. School Superintendents met with Public Health Solutions and determined that this action would help prevent exposure to our area to flatten the curve and decrease the spread of disease.

a.aria-label: Read more about COVID-19 Pandemic update for Southern Public Schools March 23, 2020

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

font.bgcolor: Southern Public Schools does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, marital status, disability, or age or in admission or access to, or treatment of employment or educational programs, and activities. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding the School District’s Non-Discrimination policies: Christopher Prososki, who may be contacted in writing at 115 South 11th Street, Wymore, NE 68466; by e-mail: cprososki@southernschools.org or by telephone at (402) 645-3326. Any person may also contact the Office for Civil Rights, U.S. Department of Education, by email at OCR.KansasCity@ed.gov; by telephone at (816) 268-0550; or by fax at (816) 268-0599, regarding compliance with the regulations implementing Title VI, Title IX, Section 504, or any other applicable laws.
